name: Valamar Dubrovnik President Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were dealt with very professionally and courteously by the member of staff at reception, and shortly after taken to our room, which we had pre-booked with a sea-view. We were not disappointed with the view - the hotel is on the bay with a beautiful view out to the Croatian islands and a private stretch of beach. The room itself was very well-appointed and was extremely clean.
reviews.title: An excellent location, with sea view, very good breakfast and attentive staff
One of the best
reviews.text: Breakfast, which we had pre-booked, was buffet style accompnaied by friendly watier/waitress service. The choice was very good and included both continental and cooked options, the quality was similarly very good. Breakfast could be taken either indoors or on the adjacent roof-top terrace.

Although some distance outsde the walls of the 'old town' of Dubrovnik, there was a very frequent bus service from the bus stop opposite the hotel right into the entrance to the walled town. In effect the hotel was situated in a prime localtion to afford excellent sea views coupled with a private beach and swimming area - within easy reach of the towm.
reviews.title: Huge Interesting property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I would have no hesitation in staying there in future, alhtough it is a but expensive, albeit this is expected at the end of the summer season.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 2 days with bargain price during low season in April. We are absolutly satisfied with the quality we've got.
reviews.title: Really liked this hotel

reviews.text: Hotel President in Dubrovnik is a c25 min ride from the airport (Kuma 250 by cab) and although it may seem far from Dubrovnik's main attraction - the Old Town - it isn't as a local bus starts/terminates outside the hotel and goes direct to the Old Town. Cost Kuma 10 or Kuma 8 if you purchase tickets from hotel reception.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice welcome and easy transition to our room which was a good size and clean (+cleaned regularly). There was also a very large terrace which overlooked the sea. In the room the usual 4* accompanients were available (hairdryer, bathroom goodies, including generous supply of shower gel, TV, room service (didn't use). The hotel has a small gym (x3 cardio machines and a weights machine) very modern and adequate. The spa is wonderful, including 2 saunas a steam room a foot spa, outdoor jacuzzi and indoor relaxation room as well as a big indoor swimming pool. You can also book treatments such as massage (which I'd highly recommend) at an additional cost. There's also an on-site hairdresser. There's acess to a small pebble beach and beach bar in a great location. I imagine it would be pretty busy in high season.
reviews.title: sad excuss for a hotel

reviews.text: We had a great stay at this hotel. There is a town bus that stops right outside the hotel and will take you to the Old City. It was easy and convenient. The rooms were clean and modern. We looked into the Hilton; this was a little less expensive and worked out well. Three people shared the room and we were comfortable!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay...great choice...if you do not want to pay the Hilton prices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights. Our room was much better than expected, spacious with sofas, large terrace/balcony overlooking the beach with great sea, coastal and sunset views. Our bed was decorated with fresh rose petals and the room was very modern and light. The bathroom probably needs a refurb however was quite satisfactory. The staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast offered a great selection of hot and cold foods. We found the piano bar most inviting and relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. Transport via the local buses to and from the hotel was excellent, being at the end of the line always ensured you got a seat and no confusion about where to get on/off. If we ever come back to Dubrovnik we would definitely stay again and would definitely recommend the hotel to others.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, location and services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove down the coast of Croatia for over 2 weeks before arriving in Dubrovnik. the hotel is located on the Babin Kuk section-a peninsula to the north of the walled city. The front desk was excellent-they immediately called the rental car company and made arraingements for the rental car company to send someone to the hotel to pick up our rented car (you have to be slightly insane to drive in Dubrovnik). We had arrived early and the room wasn't quite ready so we dropped our bags, had a great lunch on the outside terrace overlooking the adriatic with a great glass of local white wine. The room was excellent. spacious with a sitting area and a large deck/patio. The location is outside of the downtown area, but the buses stop right in front of the hotel and travel to the Pile Gate of the walled city every 15 minutes-and they're on time!! According to local cab drivers and tour guides, the Dubrovnik President is the bast hotel in town. We believe it and will stay again when in Croatia.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Dubrovnik

description: The hotel is situated on the Babin Kuk peninsula and is part of the Babin Kuk Hotel Enterprise. The complex has 12 earth tennis courts, a set of table-tennis boards, grounds for volleyball, football, handball, boccie, and mini-golf. Water sports feature wind-surfing, water-skiing, rowing and sailing. It has its own beach and harbour for boats; nudist beach and an indoor swimming pool. There are also attractive jogging tracks (total length 4 km) leading along the seaboard of the peninsula.
